thread.title: Ex-Manchester United flop Alexander Buttner mocks Liverpool legend Steven Gerrard over his lack of Premier League winners medals
thread.title_full: Ex-Manchester United flop Alexander Buttner mocks Liverpool legend Steven Gerrard over his lack of Premier League winners medals

author: leeastley
title: Ex-Manchester United flop Alexander Buttner mocks Liverpool legend Steven Gerrard over his lack of Premier League winners medals
text:
EFL Butt of the joke Ex-Manchester United flop Alexander Buttner mocks Liverpool legend Steven Gerrard over his lack of Premier League winners medals 
The Dutchman made 28 appearances in two seasons at Old Trafford before moved to Dynamo Moscow in 2014 By LEE ASTLEY Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments FORMER Manchester United defender Alexander Buttner has claimed he was a success in the Premier League – because he won more titles than Steven Gerrard. 
The Dutchman made 28 appearances in two seasons at Old Traffford before moving to Dynamo Moscow in 2014. Getty Images 4 Alexander Buttner won the Premier League with Sir Alex Ferguson in 2013 
But despite never holding down a first-team place under Sir Alex Ferguson or David Moyes, the left-back says the fact he won the league – and Gerrard did not – proves he triumphed in England. Buttner told De Telegraaf: “I was on the pitch for United 30 times. Who can say that he has been a champion in England? “I can. Even Steven Gerrard did not succeed. “I’ve become a much better football player, I played in the quarter-finals of the Champions League against Bayern Munich and Arjen Robben.” 
Buttner was signed by Ferguson back in 2012 on a five-year deal and was named man of the match during a 4-0 win against Wigan. EPA Steven Gerrard failed to win the Premier League during his 17 years at Liverpool News Group Newspapers Ltd Alexander Buttner scored and set one up against Wigan when he first joined related stories 'i'll be back' Louis van Gaal in retirement U-turn as former Manchester United boss insists he is only taking year out UNITED BACK ON BOX Manchester United WILL be on TV for the 56th FA Cup tie in a row after Crystal Palace beat Bolton RED ALERT Man United become first club to appoint a counter-terrorism expert over fears of an attack Ant is the One Antoine Griezmann has already 'verbally agreed' his shirt number AND wage with Manchester United United on the Mend Luke Shaw's future put in further doubt as Man United eye move for Monaco's Benjamin Mendy Ant is the One Antoine Griezmann has already 'verbally agreed' his shirt number AND wage with Manchester United PA:Press Association 4 Buttner struggled to hold down a regular first-team place at Manchester United 
The former Vitesse star made just five appearances for United in his debut season but was given a winner’s medal after the Premier League relaxed their eligibility rules. 
Ferguson said: “[Alexander] Buttner’s been great because he’s travelled to every away game with us, he’s been involved in every single training session, he’s played three times and been a substitute another ten times, something like that. 
“So I think that’s a contribution.” 
Gerrard failed to win the Premier League, but he did win the Champions League, the UEFA Cup, the FA Cup twice and the League Cup on three occasions in 17 years at Anfield. Manchester United 1-1 Liverpool : Ibrahimovic rescues Red Devils after Milner scores penalty
